SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AceCard
The AceCard class represents a specific type of card.
AceListener
 
BasicKingCard
Class representing a Basic King card.
Card
The Card class represents a card in a standard deck of playing cards.
CardColour
 
CardValue
 
ChoosingRoomController
The ChoosingRoomController class is responsible for handling events and actions related to the choosing room view.
Client
The Client class is responsible for handling all client-side communication with the server.
ClientMessage
Class representing a message sent from the client to the server.
DeckOfCards
The DeckOfCards class represents a deck of playing cards.
FightingKingCard
Represents a Fighting King card.
FourCard
The FourCard class extends the Card class and represents a Four card.
GameController
GameController is the main class responsible for controlling the game logic and communication between the server and the client.
GameEndingController
GameEndingController class handles the game ending scene.
GameQuitController
GameEndingController class handles the game quited scene.
Hand
The Hand class represents a collection of Card objects in a player hand.
JackCard
The JackCard class represents a playing card with the value of Jack.
JackListener
 
LoggingController
LoggingController is a class that handles the logic for the login scene of the application.
Main
The main method of the class launches the application by calling the launch() method.
NamesAndStoredDetails
The NamesAndStoredDetails class implements Serializable, and is responsible for storing player information such as name, password, avatar path, and number of won games.
Player
Player class is responsible for representing a player in a game.
QueenCard
The QueenCard class represents a card with the value of Queen.
RegisterController
RegisterController is a class that contains the logic of the registration scene.
RoomController
RoomController class is responsible for handling the room scene where user will wait for other players to join the game.
SaveAndRestoreData
The SaveAndRestoreData class provides methods to save and restore the state of a NamesAndStoredDetails object to/from a binary file.
Server
The Server class is responsible for handling the socket connections and creating new game rooms for players to play in.
ServerGame
The ServerGame class is responsible for handling the state of a game of Makao on the server side.
ServerMessage
The class ServerMessage is used to represent the messages sent by the server to the clients.
ServerPlayer
The class ServerPlayer implements the Runnable interface and is responsible for handling the communication between the server and a single client.
Stack
The Stack class represents a stack of cards that has been played.
StateOfRound
The StateOfRound class is responsible for keeping track of all the information related to the state of the current round.
TwoOrThreeCard
The TwoOrThreeCard represents a card with a value of 2 or 3.
